63 SFE_ADS122C04::SFE_ADS122C04(void)

65  // Constructor

68 //Attempt communication with the device and initialise it
69 //Return true if successful
70 bool SFE_ADS122C04::begin(uint8_t deviceAddress, std::string bus)
71 {
72  _deviceAddress = deviceAddress; //If provided, store the I2C address from user
73  _i2c_fd = 0;
74  _wireMode = ADS122C04_RAW_MODE; //Default to using 'safe' settings (disable the IDAC current sources)
75 
76  // wait for power-on reset to complete (datasheet says we should do this)
77  // minimum of 500us required
78  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(1));
79 
80  if ((_i2c_fd = open(bus.c_str(), O_RDWR)) < 0) std::exit(1);
81 
82  if (ioctl(_i2c_fd, I2C_SLAVE, _deviceAddress) < 0){
83  close(_i2c_fd);
84  std::exit(1);
85  }
86 
87  // Get functionality flags
88  unsigned long funcs;
89  if (ioctl(_i2c_fd, I2C_FUNCS, &funcs) < 0){
90  LOG("Failed to read I2C functionality.");
91  exit(1);
92  }
93 
94  reset(); // reset the ADS122C04 (datasheet says we should do this)
95 
96  // Default to using 'safe' settings (disable the IDAC current sources)
97  return(configureADCmode(ADS122C04_RAW_MODE));
98 }
99 
100 // Configure the chip for the selected wire mode
101 bool SFE_ADS122C04::configureADCmode(uint8_t wire_mode, uint8_t rate)
102 {
103  ADS122C04_initParam initParams; // Storage for the chip parameters
104 
105  if (wire_mode == ADS122C04_4WIRE_MODE) // 4-wire mode
106  {
107  initParams.inputMux = ADS122C04_MUX_AIN1_AIN0; // Route AIN1 to AINP and AIN0 to AINN
108  initParams.gainLevel = ADS122C04_GAIN_8; // Set the gain to 8
109  initParams.pgaBypass = ADS122C04_PGA_ENABLED; // The PGA must be enabled for gains >= 8
110  initParams.dataRate = rate; // Set the data rate (samples per second). Defaults to 20
111  initParams.opMode = ADS122C04_OP_MODE_NORMAL; // Disable turbo mode
112  initParams.convMode = ADS122C04_CONVERSION_MODE_SINGLE_SHOT; // Use single shot mode
113  initParams.selectVref = ADS122C04_VREF_EXT_REF_PINS; // Use the external REF pins
114  initParams.tempSensorEn = ADS122C04_TEMP_SENSOR_OFF; // Disable the temperature sensor
115  initParams.dataCounterEn = ADS122C04_DCNT_DISABLE; // Disable the data counter
116  initParams.dataCRCen = ADS122C04_CRC_DISABLED; // Disable CRC checking
117  initParams.burnOutEn = ADS122C04_BURN_OUT_CURRENT_OFF; // Disable the burn-out current
118  initParams.idacCurrent = ADS122C04_IDAC_CURRENT_1000_UA; // Set the IDAC current to 1mA
119  initParams.routeIDAC1 = ADS122C04_IDAC1_AIN3; // Route IDAC1 to AIN3
120  initParams.routeIDAC2 = ADS122C04_IDAC2_DISABLED; // Disable IDAC2
121  _wireMode = ADS122C04_4WIRE_MODE; // Update the wire mode
122  }
123  else if (wire_mode == ADS122C04_4WIRE_HI_TEMP) // 4-wire mode for high temperatures (gain = 4)
124  {
125  initParams.inputMux = ADS122C04_MUX_AIN1_AIN0; // Route AIN1 to AINP and AIN0 to AINN
126  initParams.gainLevel = ADS122C04_GAIN_4; // Set the gain to 4
127  initParams.pgaBypass = ADS122C04_PGA_ENABLED; // Enable the PGA
128  initParams.dataRate = rate; // Set the data rate (samples per second). Defaults to 20
129  initParams.opMode = ADS122C04_OP_MODE_NORMAL; // Disable turbo mode
130  initParams.convMode = ADS122C04_CONVERSION_MODE_SINGLE_SHOT; // Use single shot mode
131  initParams.selectVref = ADS122C04_VREF_EXT_REF_PINS; // Use the external REF pins
132  initParams.tempSensorEn = ADS122C04_TEMP_SENSOR_OFF; // Disable the temperature sensor
133  initParams.dataCounterEn = ADS122C04_DCNT_DISABLE; // Disable the data counter
134  initParams.dataCRCen = ADS122C04_CRC_DISABLED; // Disable CRC checking
135  initParams.burnOutEn = ADS122C04_BURN_OUT_CURRENT_OFF; // Disable the burn-out current
136  initParams.idacCurrent = ADS122C04_IDAC_CURRENT_1000_UA; // Set the IDAC current to 1mA
137  initParams.routeIDAC1 = ADS122C04_IDAC1_AIN3; // Route IDAC1 to AIN3
138  initParams.routeIDAC2 = ADS122C04_IDAC2_DISABLED; // Disable IDAC2
139  _wireMode = ADS122C04_4WIRE_HI_TEMP; // Update the wire mode
140  }
141  else if (wire_mode == ADS122C04_3WIRE_MODE) // 3-wire mode
142  {
143  initParams.inputMux = ADS122C04_MUX_AIN1_AIN0; // Route AIN1 to AINP and AIN0 to AINN
144  initParams.gainLevel = ADS122C04_GAIN_8; // Set the gain to 8
145  initParams.pgaBypass = ADS122C04_PGA_ENABLED; // The PGA must be enabled for gains >= 8
146  initParams.dataRate = rate; // Set the data rate (samples per second). Defaults to 20
147  initParams.opMode = ADS122C04_OP_MODE_NORMAL; // Disable turbo mode
148  initParams.convMode = ADS122C04_CONVERSION_MODE_SINGLE_SHOT; // Use single shot mode
149  initParams.selectVref = ADS122C04_VREF_EXT_REF_PINS; // Use the external REF pins
150  initParams.tempSensorEn = ADS122C04_TEMP_SENSOR_OFF; // Disable the temperature sensor
151  initParams.dataCounterEn = ADS122C04_DCNT_DISABLE; // Disable the data counter
152  initParams.dataCRCen = ADS122C04_CRC_DISABLED; // Disable CRC checking
153  initParams.burnOutEn = ADS122C04_BURN_OUT_CURRENT_OFF; // Disable the burn-out current
154  initParams.idacCurrent = ADS122C04_IDAC_CURRENT_500_UA; // Set the IDAC current to 0.5mA
155  initParams.routeIDAC1 = ADS122C04_IDAC1_AIN2; // Route IDAC1 to AIN2
156  initParams.routeIDAC2 = ADS122C04_IDAC2_AIN3; // Route IDAC2 to AIN3
157  _wireMode = ADS122C04_3WIRE_MODE; // Update the wire mode
158  }
159  else if (wire_mode == ADS122C04_3WIRE_HI_TEMP) // 3-wire mode for high temperatures (gain = 4)
160  {
161  initParams.inputMux = ADS122C04_MUX_AIN1_AIN0; // Route AIN1 to AINP and AIN0 to AINN
162  initParams.gainLevel = ADS122C04_GAIN_4; // Set the gain to 4
163  initParams.pgaBypass = ADS122C04_PGA_ENABLED; // Enable the PGA
164  initParams.dataRate = rate; // Set the data rate (samples per second). Defaults to 20
165  initParams.opMode = ADS122C04_OP_MODE_NORMAL; // Disable turbo mode
166  initParams.convMode = ADS122C04_CONVERSION_MODE_SINGLE_SHOT; // Use single shot mode
167  initParams.selectVref = ADS122C04_VREF_EXT_REF_PINS; // Use the external REF pins
168  initParams.tempSensorEn = ADS122C04_TEMP_SENSOR_OFF; // Disable the temperature sensor
169  initParams.dataCounterEn = ADS122C04_DCNT_DISABLE; // Disable the data counter
170  initParams.dataCRCen = ADS122C04_CRC_DISABLED; // Disable CRC checking
171  initParams.burnOutEn = ADS122C04_BURN_OUT_CURRENT_OFF; // Disable the burn-out current
172  initParams.idacCurrent = ADS122C04_IDAC_CURRENT_500_UA; // Set the IDAC current to 0.5mA
173  initParams.routeIDAC1 = ADS122C04_IDAC1_AIN2; // Route IDAC1 to AIN2
174  initParams.routeIDAC2 = ADS122C04_IDAC2_AIN3; // Route IDAC2 to AIN3
175  _wireMode = ADS122C04_3WIRE_HI_TEMP; // Update the wire mode
176  }
177  else if (wire_mode == ADS122C04_2WIRE_MODE) // 2-wire mode
178  {
179  initParams.inputMux = ADS122C04_MUX_AIN1_AIN0; // Route AIN1 to AINP and AIN0 to AINN
180  initParams.gainLevel = ADS122C04_GAIN_8; // Set the gain to 8
181  initParams.pgaBypass = ADS122C04_PGA_ENABLED; // The PGA must be enabled for gains >= 8
182  initParams.dataRate = rate; // Set the data rate (samples per second). Defaults to 20
183  initParams.opMode = ADS122C04_OP_MODE_NORMAL; // Disable turbo mode
184  initParams.convMode = ADS122C04_CONVERSION_MODE_SINGLE_SHOT; // Use single shot mode
185  initParams.selectVref = ADS122C04_VREF_EXT_REF_PINS; // Use the external REF pins
186  initParams.tempSensorEn = ADS122C04_TEMP_SENSOR_OFF; // Disable the temperature sensor
187  initParams.dataCounterEn = ADS122C04_DCNT_DISABLE; // Disable the data counter
188  initParams.dataCRCen = ADS122C04_CRC_DISABLED; // Disable CRC checking
189  initParams.burnOutEn = ADS122C04_BURN_OUT_CURRENT_OFF; // Disable the burn-out current
190  initParams.idacCurrent = ADS122C04_IDAC_CURRENT_1000_UA; // Set the IDAC current to 1mA
191  initParams.routeIDAC1 = ADS122C04_IDAC1_AIN3; // Route IDAC1 to AIN3
192  initParams.routeIDAC2 = ADS122C04_IDAC2_DISABLED; // Disable IDAC2
193  _wireMode = ADS122C04_2WIRE_MODE; // Update the wire mode
194  }
195  else if (wire_mode == ADS122C04_2WIRE_HI_TEMP) // 2-wire mode for high temperatures (gain = 4)
196  {
197  initParams.inputMux = ADS122C04_MUX_AIN1_AIN0; // Route AIN1 to AINP and AIN0 to AINN
198  initParams.gainLevel = ADS122C04_GAIN_4; // Set the gain to 4
199  initParams.pgaBypass = ADS122C04_PGA_ENABLED; // Enable the PGA
200  initParams.dataRate = rate; // Set the data rate (samples per second). Defaults to 20
201  initParams.opMode = ADS122C04_OP_MODE_NORMAL; // Disable turbo mode
202  initParams.convMode = ADS122C04_CONVERSION_MODE_SINGLE_SHOT; // Use single shot mode
203  initParams.selectVref = ADS122C04_VREF_EXT_REF_PINS; // Use the external REF pins
204  initParams.tempSensorEn = ADS122C04_TEMP_SENSOR_OFF; // Disable the temperature sensor
205  initParams.dataCounterEn = ADS122C04_DCNT_DISABLE; // Disable the data counter
206  initParams.dataCRCen = ADS122C04_CRC_DISABLED; // Disable CRC checking
207  initParams.burnOutEn = ADS122C04_BURN_OUT_CURRENT_OFF; // Disable the burn-out current
208  initParams.idacCurrent = ADS122C04_IDAC_CURRENT_1000_UA; // Set the IDAC current to 1mA
209  initParams.routeIDAC1 = ADS122C04_IDAC1_AIN3; // Route IDAC1 to AIN3
210  initParams.routeIDAC2 = ADS122C04_IDAC2_DISABLED; // Disable IDAC2
211  _wireMode = ADS122C04_2WIRE_HI_TEMP; // Update the wire mode
212  }
213  else if (wire_mode == ADS122C04_TEMPERATURE_MODE) // Internal temperature mode
214  {
215  initParams.inputMux = ADS122C04_MUX_AIN1_AIN0; // Route AIN1 to AINP and AIN0 to AINN
216  initParams.gainLevel = ADS122C04_GAIN_1; // Set the gain to 1
217  initParams.pgaBypass = ADS122C04_PGA_DISABLED;
218  initParams.dataRate = rate; // Set the data rate (samples per second). Defaults to 20
219  initParams.opMode = ADS122C04_OP_MODE_NORMAL; // Disable turbo mode
220  initParams.convMode = ADS122C04_CONVERSION_MODE_SINGLE_SHOT; // Use single shot mode
221  initParams.selectVref = ADS122C04_VREF_INTERNAL; // Use the internal 2.048V reference
222  initParams.tempSensorEn = ADS122C04_TEMP_SENSOR_ON; // Enable the temperature sensor
223  initParams.dataCounterEn = ADS122C04_DCNT_DISABLE; // Disable the data counter
224  initParams.dataCRCen = ADS122C04_CRC_DISABLED; // Disable CRC checking
225  initParams.burnOutEn = ADS122C04_BURN_OUT_CURRENT_OFF; // Disable the burn-out current
226  initParams.idacCurrent = ADS122C04_IDAC_CURRENT_OFF; // Disable the IDAC current
227  initParams.routeIDAC1 = ADS122C04_IDAC1_DISABLED; // Disable IDAC1
228  initParams.routeIDAC2 = ADS122C04_IDAC2_DISABLED; // Disable IDAC2
229  _wireMode = ADS122C04_TEMPERATURE_MODE; // Update the wire mode
230  }
231  else if (wire_mode == ADS122C04_RAW_MODE) // Raw mode : disable the IDAC and use the internal reference
232  {
233  initParams.inputMux = ADS122C04_MUX_AIN1_AIN0; // Route AIN1 to AINP and AIN0 to AINN
234  initParams.gainLevel = ADS122C04_GAIN_1; // Set the gain to 1
235  initParams.pgaBypass = ADS122C04_PGA_DISABLED;
236  initParams.dataRate = rate; // Set the data rate (samples per second). Defaults to 20
237  initParams.opMode = ADS122C04_OP_MODE_NORMAL; // Disable turbo mode
238  initParams.convMode = ADS122C04_CONVERSION_MODE_SINGLE_SHOT; // Use single shot mode
239  initParams.selectVref = ADS122C04_VREF_INTERNAL; // Use the internal 2.048V reference
240  initParams.tempSensorEn = ADS122C04_TEMP_SENSOR_OFF; // Disable the temperature sensor
241  initParams.dataCounterEn = ADS122C04_DCNT_DISABLE; // Disable the data counter
242  initParams.dataCRCen = ADS122C04_CRC_DISABLED; // Disable CRC checking
243  initParams.burnOutEn = ADS122C04_BURN_OUT_CURRENT_OFF; // Disable the burn-out current
244  initParams.idacCurrent = ADS122C04_IDAC_CURRENT_OFF; // Disable the IDAC current
245  initParams.routeIDAC1 = ADS122C04_IDAC1_DISABLED; // Disable IDAC1
246  initParams.routeIDAC2 = ADS122C04_IDAC2_DISABLED; // Disable IDAC2
247  _wireMode = ADS122C04_RAW_MODE; // Update the wire mode
248  }
249  else if (wire_mode == ADS122C04_POL_OP_MODE)
250  {
251  initParams.inputMux = ADS122C04_MUX_AIN1_AIN0;
252  initParams.gainLevel = ADS122C04_GAIN_1; // May change step size
253  //initParams.gainLevel = ADS122C04_GAIN_8; // May change step size
254  initParams.pgaBypass = ADS122C04_PGA_ENABLED; // PGA should be enabled.
255  initParams.dataRate = rate;
256  initParams.opMode = ADS122C04_OP_MODE_NORMAL;
257  initParams.convMode = ADS122C04_CONVERSION_MODE_CONTINUOUS; // May change to continuous (DCNT)
258  //initParams.convMode = ADS122C04_CONVERSION_MODE_SINGLE_SHOT; // May change to continuous (DCNT)
259  initParams.selectVref = ADS122C04_VREF_INTERNAL; // Might be an issue
260  initParams.tempSensorEn = ADS122C04_TEMP_SENSOR_OFF;
261  initParams.dataCounterEn = ADS122C04_DCNT_DISABLE;
262  initParams.dataCRCen = ADS122C04_CRC_DISABLED;
263  initParams.burnOutEn = ADS122C04_BURN_OUT_CURRENT_OFF;
264  initParams.idacCurrent = ADS122C04_IDAC_CURRENT_OFF;
265  initParams.routeIDAC1 = ADS122C04_IDAC1_DISABLED;
266  initParams.routeIDAC2 = ADS122C04_IDAC2_DISABLED;
267  _wireMode = ADS122C04_POL_OP_MODE;
268  }
269  else
270  {
271  if (_printDebug == true)
272  {
273  LOG("configureADCmode: unknown mode");
274  }
275  return(false);
276  }
277  lastInitParams = initParams; // Record last init params
278  return(ADS122C04_init(&initParams)); // Configure the chip
279 }

310 float SFE_ADS122C04::readPT100Centigrade(void) // Read the temperature in Centigrade
311 {
312  raw_voltage_union raw_v; // union to convert uint32_t to int32_t
313  unsigned long start_time = _millis(); // Record the start time so we can timeout
314  bool drdy = false; // DRDY (1 == new data is ready)
315  float ret_val = 0.0; // Return value
316  float RTD, POLY; // Variables needed to convert RTD to Centigrade
317 
318  // Start the conversion (assumes we are using single shot mode)
319  start();
320 
321  // Wait for DRDY to go valid
322  while((drdy == false) && (_millis() < (start_time + ADS122C04_CONVERSION_TIMEOUT)))
323  {
324  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(5)); // Don't pound the bus too hard
325  drdy = checkDataReady();
326  }
327 
328  // Check if we timed out
329  if (drdy == false)
330  {
331  if (_printDebug == true)
332  {
333  LOG("readPT100Centigrade: checkDataReady timed out");
334  }
335  return(ret_val);
336  }
337 
338  // Read the conversion result
339  if(ADS122C04_getConversionData(&raw_v.UINT32) == false)
340  {
341  if (_printDebug == true)
342  {
343  LOG("readPT100Centigrade: ADS122C04_getConversionData failed");
344  }
345  return(ret_val);
346  }
347 
348  // The raw voltage is in the bottom 24 bits of raw_temp
349  // If we just do a <<8 we will multiply the result by 256
350  // Instead pad out the MSB with the MS bit of the 24 bits
351  // to preserve the two's complement
352  if ((raw_v.UINT32 & 0x00800000) == 0x00800000)
353  {
354  raw_v.UINT32 |= 0xFF000000;
355  }
356 
357  // raw_v.UINT32 now contains the ADC result, correctly signed
358  // Now we need to convert it to temperature using the PT100 resistance,
359  // the gain, excitation current and reference resistor value
360 
361  // Formulae are taken from:
362  // http://www.ti.com/lit/an/sbaa275/sbaa275.pdf
363  // https://www.analog.com/media/en/technical-documentation/application-notes/AN709_0.pdf
364 
365  // 2^23 is 8388608
366  RTD = ((float)raw_v.INT32) / 8388608.0; // Load RTD with the scaled ADC value
367  RTD *= PT100_REFERENCE_RESISTOR; // Multiply by the reference resistor
368  // Use the correct gain for high and low temperatures
369  if ((_wireMode == ADS122C04_4WIRE_HI_TEMP) || (_wireMode == ADS122C04_3WIRE_HI_TEMP) || (_wireMode == ADS122C04_2WIRE_HI_TEMP))
370  {
371  RTD /= PT100_AMP_GAIN_HI_TEMP; // Divide by the amplifier gain for high temperatures
372  }
373  else
374  {
375  RTD /= PT100_AMPLIFIER_GAIN; // Divide by the amplifier gain for low temperatures
376  }
377  if ((_wireMode == ADS122C04_3WIRE_MODE) || (_wireMode == ADS122C04_3WIRE_HI_TEMP)) // If we are using 3-wire mode
378  {
379  RTD *= 2.0; // 3-wire mode needs a factor of 2
380  }
381 
382  // RTD now contains the PT100 resistance in Ohms
383  // Now we need to convert this to temperature
384 
385  // Calculate the temperature
386  ret_val = RTD * -23.10e-9;
387  ret_val += 17.5848089e-6;
388  ret_val = sqrt(ret_val);
389  ret_val -= 3.9083e-3;
390  ret_val /= -1.155e-6;
391 
392  // Check if the temperature is positive, return if it is
393  if (ret_val >= 0.0)
394  return(ret_val);
395 
396  // The temperature is negative so we need to use a different formula
397  ret_val = -242.02;
398  ret_val += 2.2228 * RTD;
399  POLY = RTD * RTD; // Load the polynomial with RTD^2
400  ret_val += 2.5859e-3 * POLY;
401  POLY *= RTD; // Load the polynomial with RTD^3
402  ret_val -= 4.8260e-6 * POLY;
403  POLY *= RTD; // Load the polynomial with RTD^4
404  ret_val -= 2.8183e-8 * POLY;
405  POLY *= RTD; // Load the polynomial with RTD^5
406  ret_val += 1.5243e-10 * POLY;
407 
408  return(ret_val);
409 }
410 
411 float SFE_ADS122C04::readPT100Fahrenheit(void) // Read the temperature in Fahrenheit
412 {
413  return((readPT100Centigrade() * 1.8) + 32.0); // Read Centigrade and convert to Fahrenheit
414 }
415 
416 // Read the raw signed 24-bit ADC value as int32_t
417 // The result needs to be multiplied by VREF / GAIN to convert to Volts
418 int32_t SFE_ADS122C04::readRawVoltage(uint8_t rate)
419 {
420  raw_voltage_union raw_v; // union to convert uint32_t to int32_t
421  unsigned long start_time = _millis(); // Record the start time so we can timeout
422  bool drdy = false; // DRDY (1 == new data is ready)
423  uint8_t previousWireMode = _wireMode; // Record the previous wire mode so we can restore it
424  uint8_t previousRate = ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.bit.DR; // Record the previous rate so we can restore it
425 
426  // Configure the ADS122C04 for raw mode
427  // Disable the IDAC, use the internal 2.048V reference and set the gain to 1
428  if ((configureADCmode(ADS122C04_RAW_MODE, rate)) == false)
429  {
430  if (_printDebug == true)
431  {
432  LOG("readRawVoltage: configureADCmode (1) failed");
433  }
434  return(0);
435  }
436 
437  // Start the conversion (assumes we are using single shot mode)
438  start();
439 
440  // Wait for DRDY to go valid
441  while((drdy == false) && (_millis() < (start_time + ADS122C04_CONVERSION_TIMEOUT)))
442  {
443  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(5)); // Don't pound the bus too hard
444  drdy = checkDataReady();
445  }
446 
447  // Check if we timed out
448  if (drdy == false)
449  {
450  if (_printDebug == true)
451  {
452  LOG("readRawVoltage: checkDataReady timed out");
453  }
454  configureADCmode(previousWireMode, previousRate); // Attempt to restore the previous wire mode
455  return(0);
456  }
457 
458  // Read the conversion result
459  if(ADS122C04_getConversionData(&raw_v.UINT32) == false)
460  {
461  if (_printDebug == true)
462  {
463  LOG("readRawVoltage: ADS122C04_getConversionData failed");
464  }
465  configureADCmode(previousWireMode, previousRate); // Attempt to restore the previous wire mode
466  return(0);
467  }
468 
469  // Restore the previous wire mode
470  if ((configureADCmode(previousWireMode, previousRate)) == false)
471  {
472  if (_printDebug == true)
473  {
474  LOG("readRawVoltage: configureADCmode (2) failed");
475  }
476  return(0);
477  }
478 
479  // The raw voltage is in the bottom 24 bits of raw_temp
480  // If we just do a <<8 we will multiply the result by 256
481  // Instead pad out the MSB with the MS bit of the 24 bits
482  // to preserve the two's complement
483  if ((raw_v.UINT32 & 0x00800000) == 0x00800000)
484  raw_v.UINT32 |= 0xFF000000;
485  return(raw_v.INT32);
486 }
487 
488 // Read the raw signed 24-bit ADC value as uint32_t
489 // The ADC data is returned in the least-significant 24-bits
490 // Higher functions will need to convert the result to (e.g.) int32_t
491 uint32_t SFE_ADS122C04::readADC(void)
492 {
493  uint32_t ret_val; // The return value
494 
495  // Read the conversion result
496  if(ADS122C04_getConversionData(&ret_val) == false)
497  {
498  if (_printDebug == true)
499  {
500  LOG("readADC: ADS122C04_getConversionData failed");
501  }
502  return(0);
503  }
504 
505  return(ret_val);
506 }
507 
508 // Read the internal temperature
509 float SFE_ADS122C04::readInternalTemperature(uint8_t rate)
510 {
511  internal_temperature_union int_temp; // union to convert uint16_t to int16_t
512  uint32_t raw_temp; // The raw temperature from the ADC
513  unsigned long start_time = _millis(); // Record the start time so we can timeout
514  bool drdy = false; // DRDY (1 == new data is ready)
515  float ret_val = 0.0; // The return value
516  uint8_t previousWireMode = _wireMode; // Record the previous wire mode so we can restore it
517  uint8_t previousRate = ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.bit.DR; // Record the previous rate so we can restore it
518 
519  // Enable the internal temperature sensor
520  // Reading the ADC value will return the temperature
521  if ((configureADCmode(ADS122C04_TEMPERATURE_MODE, rate)) == false)
522  {
523  if (_printDebug == true)
524  {
525  LOG("readInternalTemperature: configureADCmode (1) failed");
526  }
527  return(ret_val);
528  }
529 
530  // Start the conversion
531  start();
532 
533  // Wait for DRDY to go valid
534  while((drdy == false) && (_millis() < (start_time + ADS122C04_CONVERSION_TIMEOUT)))
535  {
536  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(5)); // Don't pound the bus too hard
537  drdy = checkDataReady();
538  }
539 
540  // Check if we timed out
541  if (drdy == false)
542  {
543  if (_printDebug == true)
544  {
545  LOG("readInternalTemperature: checkDataReady timed out");
546  }
547  // Attempt to restore the previous wire mode
548  configureADCmode(previousWireMode, previousRate);
549  return(ret_val);
550  }
551 
552  // Read the conversion result
553  if(ADS122C04_getConversionData(&raw_temp) == false)
554  {
555  if (_printDebug == true)
556  {
557  LOG("readInternalTemperature: ADS122C04_getConversionData failed");
558  }
559  configureADCmode(previousWireMode, previousRate); // Attempt to restore the previous wire mode
560  return(ret_val);
561  }
562 
563  // Restore the previous wire mode
564  if ((configureADCmode(previousWireMode, previousRate)) == false)
565  {
566  if (_printDebug == true)
567  {
568  LOG("readInternalTemperature: configureADCmode (2) failed");
569  }
570  return(ret_val);
571  }
572 
573  if (_printDebug == true)
574  {
575  // Output temp as hex to std output
576  std::stringstream ss;
577  ss <<
578  "readInternalTemperature: raw_temp (32-bit) = " << std::hex << raw_temp;
579  LOG(ss.str());
580  }
581 
582  // The temperature is in the top 14 bits of the bottom 24 bits of raw_temp
583  int_temp.UINT16 = (uint16_t)(raw_temp >> 10); // Extract the 14-bit value
584 
585  // The signed temperature is now in the bottom 14 bits of int_temp.UINT16
586  // If we just do a <<2 we will multiply the result by 4
587  // Instead we will pad out the two MS bits with the MS bit of the 14 bits
588  // to preserve the two's complement
589  if ((int_temp.UINT16 & 0x2000) == 0x2000) // Check if the MS bit is 1
590  {
591  int_temp.UINT16 |= 0xC000; // Value is negative so pad with 1's
592  }
593  else
594  {
595  int_temp.UINT16 &= 0x3FFF; // Value is positive so make sure the two MS bits are 0
596  }
597 
598  ret_val = ((float)int_temp.INT16) * TEMPERATURE_SENSOR_RESOLUTION; // Convert to float including the 2 bit shift
599  return(ret_val);
600 }
601 
602 // Configure the input multiplexer
603 bool SFE_ADS122C04::setInputMultiplexer(uint8_t mux_config)
604 {
605  if ((ADS122C04_readReg(ADS122C04_CONFIG_0_REG, &ADS122C04_Reg.reg0.all)) == false)
606  return(false);
607  ADS122C04_Reg.reg0.bit.MUX = mux_config;
608  return(ADS122C04_writeReg(ADS122C04_CONFIG_0_REG, ADS122C04_Reg.reg0.all));
609 }

746 bool SFE_ADS122C04::checkDataReady(void)
747 {

749  return(ADS122C04_Reg.reg2.bit.DRDY > 0);
750 }

866 
867 // Update ADS122C04_Reg and initialise the ADS122C04 using the supplied parameters
868 bool SFE_ADS122C04::ADS122C04_init(ADS122C04_initParam *param)
869 {
870  ADS122C04_Reg.reg0.all = 0; // Reset all four register values to the default value of 0x00
871  ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.all = 0;
872  ADS122C04_Reg.reg2.all = 0;
873  ADS122C04_Reg.reg3.all = 0;
874 
875  ADS122C04_Reg.reg0.bit.MUX = param->inputMux;
876  ADS122C04_Reg.reg0.bit.GAIN = param->gainLevel;
877  ADS122C04_Reg.reg0.bit.PGA_BYPASS = param->pgaBypass;
878 
879  ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.bit.DR = param->dataRate;
880  ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.bit.MODE = param->opMode;
881  ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.bit.CMBIT = param->convMode;
882  ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.bit.VREF = param->selectVref;
883  ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.bit.TS = param->tempSensorEn;
884 
885  ADS122C04_Reg.reg2.bit.DCNT = param->dataCounterEn;
886  ADS122C04_Reg.reg2.bit.CRC = param->dataCRCen;
887  ADS122C04_Reg.reg2.bit.BCS = param->burnOutEn;
888  ADS122C04_Reg.reg2.bit.IDAC = param->idacCurrent;
889 
890  ADS122C04_Reg.reg3.bit.I1MUX = param->routeIDAC1;
891  ADS122C04_Reg.reg3.bit.I2MUX = param->routeIDAC2;
892 
893  bool ret_val = true; // Flag to show if the four writeRegs were successful
894  // (If any one writeReg returns false, ret_val will be false)
895  ret_val &= ADS122C04_writeReg(ADS122C04_CONFIG_0_REG, ADS122C04_Reg.reg0.all);
896  ret_val &= ADS122C04_writeReg(ADS122C04_CONFIG_1_REG, ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.all);
897  ret_val &= ADS122C04_writeReg(ADS122C04_CONFIG_2_REG, ADS122C04_Reg.reg2.all);
898  ret_val &= ADS122C04_writeReg(ADS122C04_CONFIG_3_REG, ADS122C04_Reg.reg3.all);
899 
900  // Read and print the new configuration (if enableDebugging has been called)
901  printADS122C04config();
902 
903  return(ret_val);
904 }
905 
906 // Debug print of the ADS122C04 configuration
907 void SFE_ADS122C04::printADS122C04config(void)
908 {
909  if (_printDebug == true)
910  {
911  bool successful = true; // Flag to show if the four readRegs were successful
912  // (If any one readReg returns false, success will be false)
913  successful &= ADS122C04_readReg(ADS122C04_CONFIG_0_REG, &ADS122C04_Reg.reg0.all);
914  successful &= ADS122C04_readReg(ADS122C04_CONFIG_1_REG, &ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.all);
915  successful &= ADS122C04_readReg(ADS122C04_CONFIG_2_REG, &ADS122C04_Reg.reg2.all);
916  successful &= ADS122C04_readReg(ADS122C04_CONFIG_3_REG, &ADS122C04_Reg.reg3.all);
917 
918  if (successful == false)
919  {
920  LOG("printADS122C04config: readReg failed");
921  return;
922  }
923  else
924  {
925  std::stringstream ss;
926  ss <<
927  "ConfigReg0: MUX=" <<
928  ADS122C04_Reg.reg0.bit.MUX <<
929  " GAIN=" <<
930  ADS122C04_Reg.reg0.bit.GAIN <<
931  " PGA_BYPASS=" <<
932  ADS122C04_Reg.reg0.bit.PGA_BYPASS;
933  LOG(ss.str());
934  ss.clear();
935 
936  ss <<
937  "ConfigReg1: DR=" <<
938  ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.bit.DR <<
939  " MODE=" <<
940  ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.bit.MODE <<
941  " CMBIT=" <<
942  ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.bit.CMBIT <<
943  " VREF="<<
944  ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.bit.VREF <<
945  " TS=" <<
946  ADS122C04_Reg.reg1.bit.TS;
947  LOG(ss.str());
948  ss.clear();
949 
950  ss <<
951  "ConfigReg2: DCNT=" <<
952  ADS122C04_Reg.reg2.bit.DCNT <<
953  " CRC=" <<
954  ADS122C04_Reg.reg2.bit.CRC <<
955  " BCS=" <<
956  ADS122C04_Reg.reg2.bit.BCS <<
957  " IDAC=" <<
958  ADS122C04_Reg.reg2.bit.IDAC;
959  LOG(ss.str());
960  ss.clear();
961 
962  ss <<
963  "ConfigReg3: I1MUX=" <<
964  ADS122C04_Reg.reg3.bit.I1MUX <<
965  " I2MUX=" <<
966  ADS122C04_Reg.reg3.bit.I2MUX;
967  LOG(ss.str());
968  ss.clear();
969  }
970  }
971 }

976 }

981 }

986 }
987 
988 bool SFE_ADS122C04::ADS122C04_writeReg(uint8_t reg, uint8_t writeValue)
989 {
990  uint8_t command = 0;
991  command = ADS122C04_WRITE_CMD(reg);
992  return(ADS122C04_sendCommandWithValue(command, writeValue));
993 }
994 
995 bool SFE_ADS122C04::ADS122C04_readReg(uint8_t reg, uint8_t *readValue)
996 {
997  uint8_t command = 0;
998  command = ADS122C04_READ_CMD(reg);
999 
1000  *readValue = i2c_smbus_read_byte_data(_i2c_fd, (uint8_t)command);
1001  if (*readValue < 0){
1002  // -ve errno returned if the read failed.
1003  return false;
1004  }
1005 
1006  return true;
1007 }
1008 
1009 bool SFE_ADS122C04::ADS122C04_sendCommand(uint8_t command)
1010 {
1011  // Return true on success, else false. No way to recover error code.
1012  return i2c_smbus_write_byte(_i2c_fd, command) == 0;
1013 }
1014 
1015 bool SFE_ADS122C04::ADS122C04_sendCommandWithValue(uint8_t command, uint8_t value)
1016 {
1017  // Return true on success, else false. No way to recover error code.
1018  return i2c_smbus_write_byte_data(_i2c_fd, command, value) == 0;
1019 }
1020 
1021 // Read the conversion result with count byte.
1022 // The conversion result is 24-bit two's complement (signed)
1023 // and is returned in the 24 lowest bits of the uint32_t conversionData.
1024 // Hence it will always appear positive.
1025 // Higher functions will need to take care of converting it to (e.g.) float or int32_t.
1026 bool SFE_ADS122C04::ADS122C04_getConversionDataWithCount(
1027  uint32_t *conversionData,
1028  uint8_t *count
1029  ){
1030  uint8_t RXByte_s = 5;
1031  uint8_t RXByte[RXByte_s] = {0};
1032 
1033  int read = i2c_smbus_read_i2c_block_data(_i2c_fd, ADS122C04_RDATA_CMD, RXByte_s, RXByte);
1034 
1035  if (read < 0){
1036  LOG("Conversion with count read error. Code: " << read << ".");
1037  return false;
1038  }
1039 
1040  // RXByte[0] should be the number of bytes read, which should be 4
1041  if (RXByte[0] == 3){
1042  LOG("Only 3 bytes available. Enable DCNT or request"
1043  " conversion data without count.");
1044  }
1045 
1046  *count = RXByte[1];
1047  *conversionData =
1048  ((uint32_t)RXByte[4]) |
1049  ((uint32_t)RXByte[3]<<8) |
1050  ((uint32_t)RXByte[2]<<16);
1051 
1052  return(true);
1053 }
1054 
1055 // Read the conversion result.
1056 // MODIFIED FOR THE ADS112C04 INSTEAD OF ADS122C04
1057 // The 112 provides 16 bits, not 24. Again, two's complement and still
1058 // needs sign extended.
1059 // Hence it will always appear positive.
1060 // Higher functions will need to take care of converting it to (e.g.) float or int32_t.
1061 bool SFE_ADS122C04::ADS122C04_getConversionData(uint32_t *conversionData)
1062 {
1063  uint8_t RXByte_s = 2;
1064  uint8_t RXByte[RXByte_s] = {0, 0};
1065 
1066  int read = i2c_smbus_read_i2c_block_data(_i2c_fd, ADS122C04_RDATA_CMD, RXByte_s, RXByte);
1067 
1068  if (read < 0){
1069  LOG("Conversion without count, read error. Code: " << read << ".");
1070  return false;
1071  }
1072 
1073  // Otherwise the counter is disabled and the data is in the correct place.
1074  // Last element should be empty.
1075  *conversionData =
1076  ((uint32_t)RXByte[1]) |
1077  ((uint32_t)RXByte[0]<<8);
1078 
1079  // int secd = (int) *conversionData;//(((int) *conversionData) << 16) >> 16;
1080  // LOG("Conversion data " << secd);
1081 
1082  return true;
1083 }
1084 
1085 // Expose init parmeters
1086 ADS122C04_initParam* SFE_ADS122C04::getCurrentInitParams(){
1087  return &lastInitParams;
1088 }
1089 
1090 // Update chip configuration
1091 bool SFE_ADS122C04::reinitialise(){
1092  return ADS122C04_init(&lastInitParams);
1093 }
